org.timepedia.chronoscope.client.render.domain
Class TickFormatter

java.lang.Object
  org.timepedia.chronoscope.client.render.domain.TickFormatter
Direct Known Subclasses:
DateTickFormatter, IntTickFormatter
public abstract class TickFormatter
extends java.lang.Object

Provides functionality for rendering the domain axis ticks in a context-sensitive way depending on the current domain interval.

Author:
Ray Cromwell <ray@timepedia.org>, Chad Takahashi <chad@timepedia.org>

Field Detail

possibleTickSteps

protected int[] possibleTickSteps
Stores the possible "tick steps" that are relevant for a given formatter. For example, when dealing with minutes, people typically expect tick steps of 1, 2, 5, 10, 15, 30. Whereas for months, people would expect tick steps of 1, 2 (bimonthly), 3 (quarters), and 6 (semiannual).

subFormatter

protected TickFormatter subFormatter
A pointer to the next formatter to use when the domain interval to format is too small for this formatter to handle.

superFormatter

protected TickFormatter superFormatter
A pointer to this formatter's parent.

Constructor Detail

TickFormatter

protected TickFormatter(java.lang.String longestPossibleLabel)
Constructs a new formatter.

Parameters:
longestPossibleLabel - Represents the the longest possible label that could occur, given the set of all labels for this formatter. For example, if this formatter formatted days of the week, then "Saturday" should be used, since it is the longest name of the 7 days.
Method Detail

calcIdealTickStep

public final int calcIdealTickStep(double domainWidth,
                                   int maxTicksForScreen)
Attempt to find the optimal tick step (taking into account screen width, tick label width, and domain-context-dependent quantized tick steps).

formatTick

public abstract java.lang.String formatTick()
Formats the current tick as a String to be displayed on the domain axis panel.

getTickDomainValue

public abstract double getTickDomainValue()
Returns the domain value of the current tick.

getMaxTickLabelWidth

public double getMaxTickLabelWidth(Layer layer,
                                   GssProperties axisProperties)
Return the screen width of the largest possible tick label for this formatter.

getSubTickStep

public int getSubTickStep(int primaryTickStep)
Returns a suitable sub-tick step size for the given 'primaryTickStep' (i.e. the tick spacing to be used for the labeled ticks).

getTickInterval

public abstract double getTickInterval()
Returns a positive value corresponding to a single tick for this formatter. For example, if this is a day-of-month formatter, then this method would return TimeUnit.ms().

incrementTick

public abstract int incrementTick(int numTickSteps)
Increments currTick by the specified number of tick steps. Subclasses may sometimes need to override this method to modify the actual number of tick steps in order to ensure that the associated tick labels are stable when scrolling.

Returns:
the number of tick steps that were *actually* incremented; typically, this value will be the same as the numTickSteps input parameter, but in the aforementioned subclass override case, a different value could get returned (the typical case for this is a date near the end of a month).

inInterval

public boolean inInterval(double domainWidth)
Returns true if this formatter is capable of rendering the specified domain width (e.g. '2 years').

Parameters:
domainWidth - The domain width, specified in milliseconds.

isLeafFormatter

public final boolean isLeafFormatter()
Returns true only if this formatter has no subformatter.

isRootFormatter

public final boolean isRootFormatter()
Returns true only if this formatter has no superformatter.

resetToQuantizedTick

public abstract void resetToQuantizedTick(double domainX,
                                          int tickStep)
Quantizes domainX to the nearest tickStep and sets this quantized value as the current tick. For example, suppose that:
  • this is a MonthTickFormatter,
  • timeStamp = JUN-19-1985:22hrs:36min...
  • tickStep = 3 (in this context, '3' refers to 3 months).
This method would then return APR-1-1985:0hrs:0min, ....

Parameters:
domainX - -The domain value to be quantized
tickStep - - The tick step to which domainX will be quantized

getSubFormatter

public TickFormatter getSubFormatter()

getSuperFormatter

public TickFormatter getSuperFormatter()
